oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Conway Twitty interview - Joe Suglia WBUK - 1976-08-08
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording of an interview with Conway Twitty (performer) conducted by Joe Suglia on August 8, 1976 for radio station WBUK. Aired on August 21, 1976.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Conway Twitty does an introduction for this interview to be broadcast on WBUK -- Twitty says Joe Suglia is is favorite disc jockey -- Suglia talks about the last time they spoke -- Twitty talks about writing most of his songs but not This Time I've Hurt Her More Than She Loves Me -- Twitty talks about his new album and recording it -- Twitty talks about his voice changing throughout his career -- Twitty talks about his recording It's Only Make Believe and how it was re-recording -- Twitty talks about his recording The Letter and how it came to be -- Twitty talks about the simplicity in most of his recordings -- Twitty talks about releasing a single around the same time each year -- Twitty talks about singing duet with Loretta Lynn -- Twitty talks about his recording The Games That Daddy's Play -- Twitty talks about an upcoming greatest hits album -- Twitty talks about his recording After All The Good Is Gone and how it has a 1950's feel with a modern country melody -- Twitty talks about his daughters Joni Lee's and Jessica James's music careers -- Twitty talks about his recording Hello Darlin' -- Twitty talks about his recording You've Never Been This Far Before -- Joe Suglia concludes the interview
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Twitty, Conway;
